topic.title: [PSA] Trouble with "TOR:ERROR" on ubuntu after running zeronet (py3)
topic.body:
I've recently switched to the python3 branch for zeronet, but I had trouble getting tor to connect on ubuntu 19.04.

Here's the steps I took to get it to work, in case anyone in the future has issues.
* Make sure tor is installed (apt-get tor)
* Use the configuration settings from: http://localhost:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1546815090_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS
* adding your username to the debian-tor group does allow you to read it but you will keep getting read errors unless you add yourself to the group then log out.
It was news to me that group changes don't take place until the user logs out then in.

Anyways, happy to have more peers, just figured I'd share.

1556335000_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKu.body:
Welcome fellow peer!
Are you on windows? I only have ~28 peers but I have "TOR:ERROR" which I'm pretty sure is the problem.

Here's my current list of trackers.
It might help you get a few more peers?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1PZnbAYUg4AzDgJU4gtTupekoaNp1Mwizi_0

1556657973_18yjuvi7DyL85Rip57MiXEcGhkgCv.body:
You can always create different html pages and link to them:
/1Page/
=>index.html
=>blog.html
=>chat.html
Or put them into different directories:
/1Page/
=>index.html
/1Page/Blog/
=>index.html
/1Page/Chat/
=>Index.html

Personally I've been using javascript to populate the page with different <template> tags, but I'm not sure what is considered the best practice for ZeroNet
